description.narrative: Migrant and refugee children access formal and/or non-formal education, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Cross sectoral and Development Effectiveness

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Migrant and refugee children access formal and/or non-formal education

description.narrative: UNICEF provided non-formal education activities in both Open Accommodation Sites and urban areas to children aged 3-17 years old across mainland Greece and on the island of Lesvos. In addition, support was given to the Ministry of Education through interpretation services in schools, teacher training, and technical assistance. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2019
